posts.post_content:
Looking to buy a cheap T206 card (raw or very low grade PSA) - want to see if it's worth attempting to tackle the set. Post scan and price, thanks.

Zach
Check out my thread, last posted 11/3.  I'm not actively selling them right now, but if you want a low-grade, inexpensive card I'll sell you one.
Congrats on your 1st post. At this pace, look forward to hearing from you again in March 2017! :D
:)Great choice collecting T206....you will love em

Thanks for the comments. I actually posted on here back in 2010 I think, but it looks like it was all archived/deleted.

Someone has been nice enough to reach out and offer me a free t206 beater, so I'll hold off on buying any until I get that one.

Does anyone know of any threads here of people's progress in putting together a low grade set? I'd be curious to know the approximate cost involved, time it took, etc. I'm well aware this is a 'marathon' and would cost a lot of money, but I'd be curious to read people's stories of their attempts at it.

Thanks.

you can go to the forum homepage and do a search...but from experience, you find it does take some time and money...the more money you have the less time it will take. but it is a fun set to attempt. at the very least, you find that there are a bunch of ways to do sub-sets. ie Portraits, HOFers, Teams, Backs, Horizontals, Catchers, etc. Good luck!
